sentences.en: A good correspondent does not procrastinate.

sentences.en: Don't procrastinate until the day before a deadline.
sentences.cn: 不要在截止日期前拖拖拉拉.

It's easy to procrastinate when the deadline seems infinitely far away.
sentences.cn: 当最终期限总是遥遥无期时是很容易延期的.

sentences.en: Most often we procrastinate when faced with something we do not want to do.
sentences.cn: 面对不想做的事情，我们经常拖延。

sentences.en: Or you might simply procrastinate as you do not want to see the effects realizing.
sentences.cn: 或你仅简单的延迟你的效果,这是你不想见到的.

sentences.en: Pelvic infection wants to be treated early, procrastinate long meeting influence is borne.
sentences.cn: 盆腔炎要早治, 拖久了会影响生育.

sentences.en: People often procrastinate when it comes to paperwork.
sentences.cn: 遇到文书工作，人们常常会拖拖拉拉。

sentences.en: Plus, how to get out of a speeding ticket and how to use technology to procrastinate.
sentences.cn: 另外, 如何摆脱超速驾驶罚单,以及如何利用技术来拖延.

sentences.en: They are trying to procrastinate to wait for reinforcements approach.
sentences.cn: 他们在设法拖延以等待救兵来临.

sentences.en: We may procrastinate doing things, or - even if we do them - we may do them only halfheartedly.
sentences.cn: 我们可能会去拖延, 或者,即使我们真的做了,那么我们也只会用心做了一半而已.

sentences.en: While the inclination to procrastinate is common, one must fully consider the detrimental impact of unnecessary delays.
sentences.cn: 虽然拖延的倾向是普遍的, 但是人们应该充分考虑到不必要的延误造成的有害影响.

trans.tran_en: to delay doing something that you ought to do, usually because you do not want to do it
